title: Missing parameters for request on the request tab
content:
I used to use the Developer's edition of Firefox until a few months ago when the Network->Request tab of the Developer's Tools stopped displaying parameters. I've read many posts talking about a 'Params' tab, but I don't seem to have a tab with that name and have always found parameters under the Request tab. I don't recall downloading any updates, and I don't use any add ons. It just simply says "No parameters for this request" - despite being 100% certain there were parameters. I attempted several uninstall and reinstall attempts, but was never able to get them to reappear.

I switched to regular Firefox (Currently on version 78.0.2) and the problem was not present, until earlier this week. Now I am at a loss. I've searched and the only thing I've been able to find is a situation 3 years ago on Firefox 58 that was resolved.

This is happening for both POST and GET requests. Any suggestions are appreciated.

title: Download with javascript broken
content:
After updating to Firefox 78.0.1 (Linux x86_64) downloads that are initialized through JavaScript do not work.

Some examples are: - Downloading Code as a .zip File from github-projects - Downloading books from www.proflificworks.com - Downloading videorecordings from www.save.tv

In the background the download starts and a temporary file is created int the global Temp-Directory but the dialog for choosing what to do with the downloaded file does not open and the file is not moved to the default downloaddir.

Downloading of webpages (Ctrl-S) or Downloading files that are offered via an normal http-link with "Save target as ... " or "Save image as ... " do work.

Firefox (68.1.0) on Android and Opera can use this JavaScript downloads.

title: When I open a New Private Window, it appears to have focus, but does not (all add-ons disabled)
content:
Windows 10 Home (latest version) Firefox browser (latest version) Add-ons (all updated, all disabled)

In the past, when I open a New Private Window, the URL bar had focus and I could start typing immediately.

Lately, I don't know what has focus, but it's not the URL bar. I start typing and nothing happens (even though the cursor is flashing in the URL bar and it even has the blue highlight bar around it and the window title bar is bright, as if it has focus). But I have to click in the bar and then what I type appears.

I have manually disabled all add-ons, uninstalled Flash, turned off hardware acceleration and enabled the default theme, yet the problem persists. But oddly, if I use <shift> to open New Private Window in Safe Mode, the focus is correct. What else does Safe Mode adjust that might be causing this problem?

title: Images not loading for one website - they say its a Firefox issue (Forumotion)
content:
I regularly use a forum called The Dark City. its a gaming thing. They are hosted by Forumotion, who host their images in servimg.com.

For the pasts everal months, the site's own images have not been loading. It looks like this: https://i.imgur.com/YqRN7lp.png with no icons, background, banners, etc. Nothing. However, embedded images in posts DO still appear. As do adverts, as seen in the pic.

I am using Firefox, fully updated, on Mac, OS also fully updated. I use AVG as an anti-virus, and have no ad-blockers. I have cleared my caches several times, and gone through every permission on every possibly relevant page I could find, and nothing I can see if blocking anything from any of the three sites involved. I have also done thee same going through AVG to check for blocks, and even now have it disabled including firewalls, and the problem persists. Though oddly when I clear the cache for the forum page, I get SOME of the forum's images. And then the first time a cookie is loaded it all goes to pot again. And of course, its not happening with any other webstie I visit. Just Forumotion forums (including their own support forum).

I've been having the run around with Forumotion's support team to try to find a solution, and they keep coming back and saying its a browser issue. Except that its happening in other browsers I try as well, and regardless would prefer to keep using Firefox is theres a fix.

As I understand, the most up to date version of Firefox removed the ability to set permissions for image loading, making it default or set by the domain itself.

So I'm at a complete loss, and in need or msarter minds than mine.

Thanks in advance for any help you can offer.

creator: Brandonheatu

title: Firefox completely freezing my pc
content:
I've had maybe about 20-30 crashes over the past 6 months, which has only ever happened when using firefox. It discolours my screen and I'm unable to do anything on the pc unless I reset it by holding the power button. Sometimes my curser completely disappears and other times it becomes a jumbled mess but i can still move it. I have two monitors and it only discolours the one firefox is open in, which has happened to both monitors on seperate occasions. It has never discoloured both monitors at the same time.

Initially thinking this wasn't firefox, I double checked all drivers and scanned my PC with Bitdefender. Then just completley reinstalled windows 10. Monitoring my pc, most compenents sit around 30c and none are even close to having 100% usage when crashes occur. I've stress tested my pc and double checked every cord in my setup (all internal pc connections, power and display cords)

The crashes mostly happen on Twitch and Youtube, as that's what I mainly use. Though they have occured on other websites as well. I've tried disabling hardware acceleration on firefox and limiting the content process to 3. I have 4 extensions enabled, ClearURLs, Decentraleyes, HTTPS Everywhere and uBlock Origin. All off which have the firefox reccomended trophy thing.

I'm at a loss now and have no idea what else to try. I'm still not even 100% sure it's firefox, as it seems like a graphics card problem. Though I've stress tested and left it for hours and no crashes. No crashes in the hundreds of hours of gaming I've done either. My PC has only ever crashed while using firefox.

The last two tests that I can think of would be disabling all extensions or just trying a different browser and seeing what happens.

The crashes vary from multiple times per day to like once or twice a month, so any suggestions might take a while for me to test and reply with results.

Cheers
